title: MASSIVE PACKET LOSS.
body:
Since patch 6.10 I have experienced massive packet loss(only on LoL).. I have contacted my ISP and checked if there was anything wrong.. They said I was good to go but they would send someone out to check anyway. They came out replaced my modem, tested everything(replaced modem just incase port issue), everything was good to go.. But I still have packet loss.. This is very frustrating as I created a new account and have lost 2 of my placement games do-to this issue. I have contacted Riot Support via https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/ and received some help, I have done all that the person has suggested yet nothing has worked. Saying so, this has to be something related to Riots server etc because after doing some research today, I have noticed A LOT of people complaining about "Packet loss", "Invisible lag" and "teleportation?". I see something was released about 4 hours ago related to a company changing a optic fiber cord and people may experience disconnects/higher ping. I would like to know if this has anything to do with the packet loss/lagging that has affected many since 6.10 and if it has nothing to do with it, I would like Riot to look in-depth into this packet loss/lagging that is happening for players on the NA server across the west side of the globe.


Thanks!

replies.body:
The thread posted earlier today about the fiber optic cut hasn't happened yet.  Feel free to give it a read, but it won't take place for another 4-5 hours, so it doesn't seem to be the root cause at all.

Also, I would be very hesitant to say that this is a Server Wide issue.  We have all sorts of in-depth monitoring that takes a look at player connections server-wide.  We use this to identify large scale issues to see if there are more players than normal experiencing Packet Loss.  As of right now, we aren't seeing any such server-wide issues.  Consider Help and Support similar to a Doctors Office.  When you are sick, you go there to get help.  If you walked into a Doctors Office and saw a bunch of sick people, you wouldn't think that there is a worldwide epidemic going on, just that these particular people are sick.  Similar to Help and Support, people know to come here to get help if they are experiencing issues, which doesn't mean there is an epidemic.

That being said, Time Warner Cable was experiencing issues about an hour ago (but should be resolved now).  If you use TWC, that may explain why you have been experiencing these issues.  If you aren't using TWC, make sure to continue answering the specialist in your ticket!  They will not rest until they get your issue resolved!

Let me know if you have any other questions!

And this is how I know you guys are still being awful at communication AND still not working on the problem. This packet loss is not just happening to those using TWC. It's happening to all ISP providers ALL ACROSS THE GLOBE.

And, with all these ISPs saying it's not their problem, that means it is a SERVER WIDE ISSUE.

For fuck sake, dARTAGNAN, get your fucking engineers down to the server room because this shit is getting very fucking annoying. I'm sorry to cuss at you but your guys's awful communication and awful mechanics gives me no choice.

People have been complaining for weeks, and all you can say is do this or that, and that "if you walk into a doc's office and see a bunch of people there, it doesnt mean its an epidemic." IT IS AN EPIDEMIC, are you completely stupid? People wouldn't be waiting in that same doc's office for three weeks if they couldn't be healed, would they? They would fucking move on to another doctor's office.

And with the awful balancing and no SoloQ, along with this awful server problem, people are leaving for another "doctor's office."

Amazing way too word it imo, a bit harsh on the language but needed.
+1
it's getting worse too, mine is up to 20% now.
Whoa don't be toxic.

Dude, if you have been having these problems for weeks, and all they are telling you is that its your problem and that they aren't doing anything to fix it, then yes you would be as mad as I am. 

And the cussing was necessary.
Nothing excuse toxic behavior.
Well from the looks of things people agree with me. And yes this can settle as an excuse.
Interesting I have the same issue with brighthouse.  Who was purchased recently by the same company that owns Timewarner.

Hey there, just wanted to say that the evidence seems to suggest that the problems is more systemic than you suggest. I personally have Comcast and ran through all the suggestion solutions on Riot's support page, and am still experiencing games with 10-15% packet loss. It sounds like there is something going on in your infrastructure, since this issue has popped up for people across many different states and ISP's.

Just want to chime in and say I've been having to same issue for a few days now, also with Comcast. I've even gotten a new computer since it started, but that didn't effect to packet loss at all, nor have I noticed it in any of my other online games, so I have to assume it's server-based.

It's not just TWC. I'm on Cox and I've been having this issue for about 4 days now and it's really frustrating. Got to the point where it became such a nuisance that I've stopped playing league these past days.

Here's a clip: http://plays.tv/video/57537346831c136576/packet-loss-issue

Same, its not every game either, its so fking random, im scared to play ranked. it stopped for 2 days now its back again... Cox actually just upgraded my internet ha. Riot not admitting to faults. didn't they have a roundtable about communication recently? huh?

Is this idiot serious? For your job at riot did they make you match shapes to the holes they fit in? Did your mother put the shapes in the proper holes when the tester wasn't looking so you could get the job and move out of her basement? When a LOT of people start posting about the same issue at the same time  it is more of an indepth issue than "it's on your end only." Why do you even come on here to comment at all, all you are doing is insulting our intelligence.

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=q1srv6QN,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-06-04T00:04:18.439+0000)

If you aren't using TWC, make sure to continue answering the specialist in your ticket!  They will not rest until they get your issue resolved!
> 
> Let me know if you have any other questions!

I wasn't trying to be rude or anything. But people across the west side of the globe(canada, us, mexico etc.) are complaining of packet loss via LoL only.. I have contacted my ISP which is BrightHouse Networks(TWC) multiple times and talked to supervisors who looked @ my internet history and status an saw no packet loss on there end whatsoever. While I was dropping packets during a LoL custom game, I proceeded to do a network test via WWW.PingTest.Net & http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/ . Both showed that my internet/settings were perfectly fine and found no issues.
Also referring to the fiber optic wire, I was asking if this was in-place to possibly fix the packet loss or was a non-related fix/change.

TWC is not the problem. It's all ISPs. I use Verizon on a routered connection and i've been getting packet loss for nearly 2 weeks now.

I made a thread of my own http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/Zzj1oilp-east-coast-packet-lost-comcast-florida and I recorded some proof ..

please riot help
same, Cox in florida as well.

It happens on/off, sometimes it will be in the beginning of a game really bad then randomly stop mid game an continue late game... I'm losing 50-250 packets average a game, sometimes(more then 20% of time) I lose 1500+
Riot just pretending this isn't a problem, telling players it's basically their fault :/
This happened a year ago, and it's happening again, but this time they aren't living up to the shit, i followed THE FKING GUIDE AND DID ALL OF IT, and still it happened again to me tonight 20% avg.
This is actually a fucking joke right? Like when your mods are LITERALLY GETTING ROASTED ON YOUR FORUMS FOR DOING A SHIT JOB, you have to realize you're doing something wrong.
having the same issues since 6.10, steady ping with random lags. in Cali with charter
I've started having problems again just now >.< it seems ok during some times of the day but others not so much.
Riot, please tell us what to do to help you fix this. Cant play ranked at all like this.
I am having issues similar to those seen in some of the videos posted here.
Fix this craziness please! {{item:3070}}

I have this issue and created a ticket for it, too. And I'm nowhere near TWC and in fact live in Canada. It resembles this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ir91bVUFmfo

I've had no networking issues ever when it came to league, this is a first. Must mean something is wrong somewhere. All packet-loss begins and ends on Riot's servers according to the dozen tests I've ran/run during game play.
